body_html:
System information
1.I used a stock example script provided in TensorFlow
2. Windows 10 Home
3. Not on mobile device
3. Installed from binary
4. tf.version
'1.11.0-dev20180905'
5.python -V
Python 3.6.6 :: Anaconda, Inc.
6. Not Applicable
7.Not Applicable
8. Cuda_9.0.176.2_windows
CuDNN : 9.0
9. Nvidia GPU used 940MX
Memory :12 GB
10. pip install tf-nightly-gpu
https://pypi.org/project/tf-nightly-gpu/

I had installed CUDA and cuDNN without breaking anything and also set the PATH variable correctly. Still when I was training a model using Keras GPU usage was zero while CPU was maxing out.
And evidently so
sess = tf.Session(config=tf.ConfigProto(log_device_placement=True))
showed no GPU0
Hope this was explainatory and suffices the cause.

body:
System information 
1.I used a stock example script provided in TensorFlow
2. Windows 10  Home
3. Not on mobile device
3. Installed from binary
4. tf.__version__
'1.11.0-dev20180905'
5.python -V
Python 3.6.6 :: Anaconda, Inc.
6. Not Applicable 
7.Not Applicable
8. Cuda_9.0.176.2_windows
    CuDNN : 9.0 
9. Nvidia GPU used 940MX
    Memory :12 GB
10. pip install tf-nightly-gpu
       https://pypi.org/project/tf-nightly-gpu/


I had installed CUDA and cuDNN without breaking anything and also set the PATH variable correctly. Still when I was training a model using Keras GPU usage was zero while CPU was maxing out.
And evidently so
sess = tf.Session(config=tf.ConfigProto(log_device_placement=True))
showed no GPU0
Hope this was explainatory and suffices the cause.
